page.description: The TABLE_RESTRUCTURE() function takes a CR-LF delimited list of field specifications in the format [=],,, and restructures a table.

argument.name: Field_List
argument.description: CR-LF delimited list of field specifications in the format: Field_Name [ = Original_Name ], Type [ + ], Width, Dec [ = Expression ]

argument.name: Field_Name
argument.description: The new name of the field to restructure.

argument.name: Original_Name
argument.description: Optional. Default = Field_Name. The original name of the field to restructure. You need to specify this if you are renaming the field. "" = delete the existing field named Field_Name and create a new one.

argument.name: Type
argument.description: The data type of the field. Adding a "+" after the field type will define the field as an auto-increment field.

argument.name: Width
argument.description: Optional. The width of the field in characters. Required only for character and numeric fields.

argument.name: Dec
argument.description: Optional. The number of decimal characters. Required only for numeric fields.

argument.name: Expression
argument.description: Optional. Defines the expression to use and creates a calculated field that will not appear in the table structure.

section.title: Example
section.description: The following example modifies the Cust2 table.
section.example: dim c2 as P c2 = table.open("cust2",FILE_RW_EXCLUSIVE) c2.table_restructure(<<%str% CUSTOMER_ID,Character,8,0 FIRSTNAME,Character,25,0 LASTNAME,Character,25,0 COMPANY,Character,32,0 PN=PHONE,Character,20,0 FAX,Character,20,0 BILL_ADDRESS_1,Character,40,0 BILL_ADDRESS_2,Character,40,0 BILL_CITY,Character,20,0 BILL_STATE_REGION,Character,20,0 BILL_POSTAL_CODE,Character,10,0 BILL_COUNTRY,Character,20,0 SHIP_ADDRESS_1,Character,40,0 SHIP_ADDRESS_2,Character,40,0 SHIP_CITY,Character,20,0 SHIP_STATE_REGION,Character,20,0 SHIP_POSTAL_CODE,Character,10,0 SHIP_COUNTRY,Character,20,0 SHIP_SAME,Logical,1,0 EMAIL,Character,60,0 NOTE,RTF %str%) c2.close()
